1.content:
For the last 24 hours the small town of Glitterice has been silent as fresh snow rains from the heavens above. At any other time it would look peaceful and serene. Instead, the town is being ravaged by forces beyond human comprehension and the whole area is slowly becoming a battleground between the living and the dead. Now you must choose someone to guide through the piling snow and pouring blood, someone who can solve the mystery of this otherworldly terror... or at least escape with their life.

Who will you follow into the unfolding nightmare?
1.title: Hell Freezes Over

choices: His home on the edge of town
11.content: Good choice. Where will Richie be starting?
11.title: Richie Westwood

111.content:
Richie pulled aside the curtain of his second floor bedroom window and scanned the snowy neighborhood surrounding him. It looked almost like one of those quaint little towns you'd see on the back of a postcard. Almost. Streaks and puddles of deep red crimson clashed with the otherwise serene landscape, the primary evidence of the slaughter that had occurred over the last twenty four hours.

Richie let out a sigh and closed the curtain as a trio of three pale figures passed by a neighboring house in search of victims. "Those things have been up and walking around since yesterday. Thank god Maggie is in another state..." he mumbled to himself as he gripped his police-issued handgun in a holster on his belt. "Its been a day now, the news has to have some explanation of what is going on here."

As he made his way downstairs to his small living room Richie cast a quick glance at his barricaded front door to make sure it still held. He wasn't sure if any of those things knew he was in here, but job experience told him it was very unwise to take chances in a life and death situation like this. After turning down the volume he switched on his small flat screen tv and tuned in to the local news channel.

A man in his late fifties was giving a report on the local area and how there had been many disappearances in the last twenty four hours, yet nothing he said seemed to acknowledge the plague of walking dead that had arisen. Either things hadn't spread too far outside the town or the reporter didn't have the slightest clue about what was really going on. This wasn't too surprising given how far Glitterice was from the rest of civilization.

Richie turned off the tv and looked out his living room window. The snow was still flurrying outside just as it had been since the day before and the ground now looked to have accumulated a good seven or eight inches. A pale figure stirred next to a parked car covered in snow and Richie quickly stepped away to avoid any unneeded attention. He hated sitting here on his ass and waiting for the government to come in and fix the situation, which could take several days even in the best circumstances.

"I'm a cop for god's sake, I should be out there helping people." Richie said to himself as he shut off the tv and headed back upstairs. He sat down on his bed and look around at the supplies he had gathered up that morning sitting on the dresser next to his bed and on a nearby table. The thought of waiting here for help wasn't so bad compared to that of heading out into a snowstorm filled with the undead, but Richie was restless from hearing the screams and chaos of the night before...
111.title: A Cold Day

choices: Richie investigates the crashed police cruiser
Richie moves on to an area with more cover
1111.content:
Richie knew he couldn't just wait here for days on end while the town descended further into chaos, if he didn't act soon hundreds of more people could die. "Alright, I'll just scout the neighborhood for now, see how many people are still alive." he said as he grabbed a duffle bag and began loading it with supplies such as spare clips for his handgun, some flares and a miniature first aid kit.

Once he had the bag half filled with equipment he slung it over his shoulder and grabbed his nightstick off of a nearby table along with his police hat. Before leaving he took the time to hide a few emergency supply stashes in case of looters and made sure everything was locked up.

After also making sure the coast was clear Richie slowly opened his front door and began carefully walking down his driveway. The bushes and abandoned vehicles made excellent spots for an ambush, something that kept him on his guard as he stepped out onto the snow covered sidewalk.

Up ahead was a large overturned semi with its back trailer door stuck half open due to some sort of jam. In the cargo hold were several stacked boxes of food such as canned goods and cereal. Most of the packages looked untouched, but a few were torn open in places and a large red smear of blood had frozen over the side of one of the containers.

Richie was just about to investigate when he noticed a wrecked police cruiser from his department crashed into someone's yard about 50 feet further down the street. The cracked windshield and bloodstains made it clear that whoever had been inside was dead, though there might still be some supplies inside it as well.

In the distance an echo of moans began softly blowing through the trees...
1111.title: Into The Cold

11111.content:
Richie doubted anyone was still alive near the truck, but it was closer than the police car and still worth a look before moving on. With his gun drawn he tried pulling the back door the rest of the way open, but it wouldn't budge any further than it already was. With a sigh Richie picked up a few miniature boxes of cereal and put them away in case he needed a snack later. Afterwards he headed up front to check where the driver should be.

Unfortunately, the sight of a blood coated door window told him all he needed to know about the unfortunate person who had been transporting the truck. "Wonder if there is anything up here that might be useful?" Richie whispered to himself as he hopped up and swung open the door. At least it wasn't locked.

A putrid smell hit Richie in the face as the image of a dead man slumped against the seat filled his vision. A trail of blood leading from a gash on the top of his head to the side of the door gave Richie all the info he needed on how the trucker perished. Just as Richie moved over to open the dash box the man stirred and let out a soft groan. Startled, Richie pulled himself back as the man opened his eyes and stared at Richie.

"What in the name of god...?" Richie whispered in a horrified tone as the glowing green light of the truckers once hazel eyes focused on him. Before he could react the man lunged and bit into Richie's arm with a mouth filled with razor sharp teeth. With a pained scream Richie instinctively pulled the trigger on his gun and fired a round through the Infectors neck that pierced the opposite door window and caused a fresh spray of blood to splatter over his face.

Gasping for breath Richie stumble out onto the snowy road with a thud, his gun dropping and landing just under the bottom of the semi. His eyes widened in fear when he realized his whole body was going numb as the zombie trucker climbed out to finish him. Richie prayed for a quick death as the thing got to its feet, but was surprised when it just stood over him, still leaking blood through its neck hole.

As Richie passed out his last confused thoughts where of the world that had existed just a few days ago. A snowy little town where the most exciting things to happen were usually just a flat tire or a disorderly drunk. As the minutes passed after his heart stopped beating the Infector lurched off in search of more prey to add to the growing hordes of undead. When Richie's eyes finally opened again they were filled with a hateful red light and a lust for carnage. After climbing to his feet he too left in search of fresh victims.
11111.title: Stopping For A Snack

choices: Search the houses for any survivors
11112.content:
Richie decided to check out the crashed police cruiser. He gripped his handgun as he approached the wrecked vehicle. Pulling open the passenger side door, Richie found a small portable radio sitting in the front passenger seat. "I might be able to use this." Richie thought as he picked it up. When he switched it on, nothing happened. Opening the battery compartment, he found it was empty. "Figures." Richie sighed, rolling his eyes as he slipped the radio into his pocket.

Walking around to the back of the cruiser, he lifted the trunk lid to find it was loaded with police equipment. It had several bulletproof vests, some SWAT tactical armor, a few pistols and submachine guns, a 12-gauge shotgun, and a riot shield. Rich put away his handgun and started sorting through everything. "This might be useful later on." Richie said to himself as he slipped a bulletproof vest over his sweater and put on the tactical armor. Putting the weapons into his duffel bag, Richie slung the bag over his shoulder and looked around at the street.

He could check any of the surrounding houses for survivors, investigate the overturned truck nearby, or head back to his house. As the moans started to get closer, Richie decided to,
11112.title: Richie investigates the crashed police cruiser

choices: Richie takes shelter in a nearby home
Richie heads back to his house
Richie tries to secure a vehicle
111121.content:
Richie knew that as a cop his primary mission was to help people and now that he had plenty of gear there was no reason for him to attempt to avoid danger if it meant saving innocent lives. With his riot shield ready to bat aside any threat he came across Richie moved down the street quickly looking for any signs of life in the nearby houses.

Things looked pretty grim with several homes broken into or boarded up, many had doors that swung gently in the frigid breeze as snow piled inside or open windows that were cracked from unknown damages. Any house that wasn't broken open was locked up tight, especially on the ground floor and few had dared to leave any sort of lighting on.

Richie let out a sigh when he received no answer after knocking on the front door of a large house with boarded up windows and a single lamp on in an upstairs bedroom. "Either no one is home, or they don't want to talk to me." he said solemnly as he walked back down the driveway and continued moving up the street.

Just as he was about to pass by an intersection and move onto the next block a small utility van sped down the opposite sidewalk and swerved sharply around a mailbox onto the next street. Just as soon as it had appeared it vanished again into the thick snowfall as the driver desperately tried to escape the monsters that had risen in Glitterice. Richie leaned onto a bent stop sign for support as he listened to the van disappear into the distance.

Had he already crossed the street its unlikely the driver would have seen him in time (or simply not care if he did) and would have run him over. "Damn, its getting more dangerous out here by the minute..." Richie gasped as his breathing slowly returned to normal. "I can't just keep going on like this..."

Suddenly, a fresh choir of moans and roars began closing in, no doubt drawn in by the sound of the speeding van...
111121.title: Close Call

1111213.content:
"Fuck, I can't keep going on foot..." Richie panted as he quickly jogged across the street and began moving past a long line of parked cars. Normally, he would be more concerned with getting out of there but as chance would have it he noticed a pair of keys still in the ignition of a a small purple van. "Shit, does this belong to someone or...?" he began to wonder as the moans drew closer. He looked up at the nearby houses, no lights on and at least two doors broken wide open.

"Screw it, whoever owned this is long gone or dead." Richie said as he smashed in the driver side window and unlocked the door. He turned the keys and held his breath as the van slowly hummed to life. "Thank god, it still works." he whispered as he pulled away from the sidewalk and began cruising down the road. The fuel meter told him he had half a tank of gas left, enough to get out of town or at least check a few places in the nearby area.

Richie rubbed his head a bit as he pulled onto the driveway of an abandoned house and tried to think for a moment. Unfortunately, the peace and quiet was short lived as a growl echoed from the back seat. He turned around just in time to see a young girl in a pink coat lunge forward and bite into his right arm. "FUCK!" Richie shouted in surprise and anger as he brought the little girl forward with his free hand and threw her against the cracked windshield.

The force wasn't strong enough to send her out onto the hood, but still powerful enough to shatter the center of the windshield and send glass flying all over the dashboard. "Jesus Christ..." Richie gasped as the little girl let go of his arm and tried to grab his face. Thinking quickly he held her at bay with his foot as he unbuckled his belt and opened the door. After tumbling outside into the cold he then struggled to his feet as the little girl spilled out of the van behind him.

Her eyes were a deep red and fresh blood poured from a wound she had received a short time before. She looked to be only about seven or eight and aside from a missing boot, the blood, her eyes and a pale face appeared to be a completely normal child. She opened her mouth to snarl as a trail of crimson poured down her lip. "I'm sorry." Richie said as he pulled his nightstick from his belt. The girl stumbled forward only to catch a powerful blow that knocked her to the ground and sent several teeth flying.

The girl looked up with a broken jaw as he brought the nightstick down on her head a second time. He swore that he heard her skull crack, though she was still trying to move forward. "I'm sorry..." Richie said once again as he delivered another blow. The little girl twitched a bit as her head split open before finally falling silent in the snow. Richie dropped his nightstick and fell backwards onto the cold ground as he watched a miniature ocean of blood flood the footprints he made in the snow around the little zombie.

After taking a few minutes to collect himself Richie picked up his nightstick and climbed back into the van. Upon checking the back seat he noticed a blood stained blanket along with a few dolls and other toys. "She must have been hurt out there...and her parents left her in the van while they went to get help or something...Jesus..." he muttered as he began to sweep the broken glass on the dashboard to the floor. Then he noticed a small red mark on his arm...right where the little girl had bitten him.

"Oh...oh fuck..." Richie whispered as he pulled back the torn cloth to see five tiny little red tooth marks on his bare arm. At least two had broken the skin and were bleeding slightly. He immediately fell back in his seat as the full weight of the horror washed over him. This was just like in those movies and comics he had read where getting bitten or scratched by the undead turned you into one. Deep down he wasn't sure if the same rules applied here, but it was a very unnerving thought.

"Fuck it, I'll just have to keep an eye on it for now...I can't waste any more time worrying. There are still people out there who I can save, even if I don't make it..." he said as he started the van back up. Not sure how much time he had left Richie did know one thing: he was going to help as many people as he could, even if he didn't make it out of this alive. The only question is...where will he start?"
1111213.title: Unexpected Passenger

choices: Tell him you don't want to
11112132.content:
Richie was silent as he drove along the snowy road carefully and quietly, speeding up only to avoid the occasional zombie that walked toward the sound of his vehicle. The wound on his arm was now disinfected and bandaged even though it still stung like a motherfucker. "Hopefully, the pain is just from the adrenaline wearing off." he thought to himself.

Soon a large white building came into view as he rounded a corner past a house that had "NO ENTRY" spray painted across the garage door in big blue letters. "There's the church." Richie said as he pulled into the surprisingly full parking lot and stepped out onto the sidewalk in front of the building.

Richie pulled out his handgun and checked its ammo before tucking it away out of sight. "Last thing I wanna do is start a fight in a church, but I wouldn't even go inside a friends house unarmed in this type of situation." he said quietly as he looked around for zombies. Amazingly enough, the coast was clear.

"Guess even the undead don't like going to church. Maybe my luck is changing." he chuckled to himself as he walked through the flurry of falling snowflakes. It was hard to keep a positive attitude after everything he had witnessed so far, but the sight of a few lights through the boarded up windows made Richie feel a calm like he hadn't since this whole ugly mess began.

With a light tap on the door he announced his presence and waited patiently for the response. After about a minute the door swung open so suddenly that it nearly startled Richie into pulling his gun. Before him stood a middle aged woman in jeans and a thick sweater. Aside from some unkempt hair she wasn't bad to look at and she seemed welcoming enough with her faint smile upon seeing Richie.

"Hello officer, I'm really glad to see you." she said warmly as she stepped back to let him in. "Please, do you have any news from the outside? Is this thing almost over?" She seemed a little nervous, but friendly enough given the circumstances. "I'm afraid I don't ma'am, whatever this is seems to be spreading like a plague. Of all the houses I checked before coming here nobody responded. Either everyone is dead or hiding out hoping this thing blows over."

"Oh..." the woman replied solemnly as her face sank a little. "I figured I expected as much but..." she trailed off as a lean man in overalls and a red and white baseball cap walked up and offered Richie his hand. "Sorry to interrupt ya, officer. I'm sure you're here to help, but everyone is a little on edge right now. Could I ask you to follow me please?"
11112132.title: Hallelujah

111121321.content:
Richie nodded his head shook the man's hand. "I'd be happy to help out with whatever you need." The man grinned upon hearing the words and gestured for Richie to follow him to the back of the building. "I guess I'll see you in a while." Richie said as he turned to the woman who had opened the door. She nodded her head and waved as Richie walked off. "See you later, officer."

The man in the hat rubbed his head as he led Richie past the pews where families and friends were huddled together, about thirty people in total, all whispering or sobbing as they discussed their current situation. "Sorry for the rude welcome." the man in the hat suddenly speaks up as he passes a pair of children coloring on the floor. "Most of us have lost people here, either to those things outside or to the weather and nobody wants to head out there and look for missing survivors. I'm Stan, by the way, the woman you met at the door is Juliana."

Richie sighs as he looks around at the sad scene before him. "I can say its pretty bad out there, I don't blame you all for huddling together in here. Things are a mess. Also, my name is Richie...we didn't have much time for introductions back there." he replies as Stan climbs a small set of stairs and heads over to a thin wooden door. "Yeah, didn't mean to hit you with everything at once, but the boss will want to meet you, then we can get everything sorted out."

Richie managed a slight smile as Stan turned the knob and held the door open. "Let's get to work then." Richie said as he turned to take one last look at the disorganized room behind him. "That's what I like to hear, friend. After you." Stan replied as he gestured for Richie to go ahead with his free hand.

Richie walked inside a darkened hallway as Stan followed behind him and flipped on a light switch. "We try to conserve power by keeping any unnecessary lights off. Plus we don't want to draw too many of those things over here, one of our guys had to smash in the skull of some poor high schooler who wandered into the parking lot with a snow shovel the other night. Still talks about how it nearly took his damn leg off with its claws."

"Jesus, I've run into a few myself...is he okay?" Richie asked as Stan escorted him down the narrow hall and around the corner. "Yeah, we go out in pairs when we need to head outside so he had some backup. Still, hell of a thing for a man to have to do." Richie just shook his head as memories of the little girl came back. "No kidding." he said solemnly.

"Here we are, officer." Stan said as he turned the knob on a door at the end of the hall and pulled it open. "Boss, you have a new visitor." Inside the room was an older man sitting behind a large wooden desk which had his crumpled shirt laying on top of it. Next to him was a pretty blonde girl in her twenties, completely nude from head to toe, leaning on his arm and rubbing her hand across his face.

"Goddamn it, I told you people to knock before entering! What is it that you don't understand about that?" the man groaned as he pushed the woman aside and put his shirt back on. He looked to be in his fifties or sixties and had a thick goatee and mustache along with a balding head and graying hair. He looked over both Richie and Stan with a sour look on his face as the woman walked over to a chair where her clothes were sitting and began to get dressed.

"Sorry for the interruption sir, but this can't wait. The new guy is a cop and he might be able to help us." Stan replied as he walked inside and pulled out a chair to sit on while gesturing for Richie to do the same. "Have a seat then, we can talk over cigars and brandy." the man said as he pulled a bottle out of the desk along with a few glasses. "So new guy, what do you think of the place?"
111121321.title: A Little Hospitality

choices: A distress signal comes over the radio
Richie hears something at the front door
Richie hears something in the garage
111123.content: Richie decided to head back toward his house. Even though his SWAT armor was keeping him fairly warm, he didn't want to risk being out in the open for too long, especially with those things roaming the streets. Richie made his way back towards his home, slightly hindered by the blizzard. After reaching the front porch, he opened the front door, stepped inside, and barricaded the front door. Sighing with relief, he sat down on the couch and laid his duffel bag on the coffee table. He then pulled out the radio he'd grabbed, walked into the kitchen retrieved a battery from one of the drawers, slid it into the battery compartment of the radio, and flipped it on. "Hello." he said into the radio's mic "Is there anyone out there that's still alive.". All Richie got was static. "Blizzard must be messing with the reception." he thought "I'll try again later.". Richie went back into the living room, sat back down on the couch, and began prepping his weapons. After half an hour,
111123.title: Return to his house

12.content: Good choice. Where will Allie be starting?
12.title: Allie DeWitt

121.content:
Allie sleeplessly stared at the clock ticking on the wall of her kitchen as the snow continued to flurry outside her closed windows. It was hard to see with the lights out, but her guess was that it was a little past noon or maybe a little before. Her son Tyson was still sleeping upstairs in his room, soundly despite the terror of the previous day.

Allie had picked him up early from school and they had stopped at a local supermarket when a man in a bloody shirt attacked a family next to her and ripped the mother's throat out when she tried to shield her children from him. In the chaos that followed she quickly scooped up her son and ran to the car before the entire store began to riot.

On the way home they had passed a few nightmarish sights and sounds, but arrived safely just as the snow began to pick up and coat their yard in a fresh blanket of white. The rest of that day had been spent trying to console her son and keeping an eye on the news for any clue as to what was happening.

Unfortunately, whatever had happened, be it a terrorist attack or some sort of pandemic, wasn't widespread enough to get more than a mention on a local channel that advised residents to stay indoors amid rioting and attacks in the street. Allie had tried phoning friends and relatives to see what was going on, but no one had a clue.

About the only positive to this situation was that the power was still on in most suburbs and that the cold weather helped deter whatever was walking around outside from finding them. Of course, that wouldn't mean much if help didn't arrive soon.

Suddenly, a loud sound came from...
121.title: Snow Day

choices: Tell him to wait there while she gets something to help him
1212.content:
Just as Allie was about to go check on Tyson a series of loud thumps echoed from the door. Startled by the noise Allie grabbed a kitchen knife off of the counter and headed over to see what the commotion was. The door had no windows so Allie had no way of knowing what lurked on the other side, which made her very nervous. "Hello, is anyone there?" she asked loudly as she readied herself to turn the knob.

"Oh thank god, please... I need help..." came the soft reply as whoever was outside leaned on the side of the house for support. "Hang on." Allie replied quickly as she slowly pulled the door open. Standing outside on her front porch was a delivery man with a thick coat covering his brown uniform. His truck was parked across the street and it looked like a nasty wound was bleeding through the cloth on his shoulder.

"What happened, did one of those things get you?" Allie asked worriedly as she stepped out onto the porch to get a better look. The snow was cold on her bare feet, but she hardly noticed as the man groaned and pulled away a bloody hand to show her the injury. Bite marks had broken the skin on his right shoulder deep enough to draw blood and tear away a good chunk of the cloth from the coat.

"It looks a lot worse than it probably is..." the man says as he forces a weak smile. "Do you have a first aid kit or some bandages I can have?" Allie frowned and took a step back, ready to slam the door closed if he tried anything. "I don't know... you could have an infection or anything... I've seen movies like this. People who get bit or scratched turn into more of whatever is attacking the town... you could become one of them."

To Allie's surprise the man lets out a gentle laugh. "I've seen my share of zombie flicks as well, hell, these things probably are some form of undead... but I already got scratched yesterday trying to get back to my neighborhood." At this point the man rolls up his sleeve to show her a few small scratch marks on his left wrist. "These things are dangerous, but whatever is causing this ain't a virus... please, can I come in?"

Allie grips her knife tightly and tries to think, what should she do...?
1212.title: A Stranger At The Door

12121.content:
Allie hated the thought of letting a stranger into her house, especially under the current circumstances, but she knew she couldn't just turn this man away in the middle of a blizzard and monster outbreak. He could very well die if left on his own, either from the wound, the cold, or whatever was lurking around the town...

"Come on in, just don't track any snow in the house and try to keep quiet. I'll see what I can scrounge up." Allie said as she pulled the door open, careful to keep her knife out of sight. "Thank you, ma'am. You may have just save my life." the man replied as he followed her into the living room. "My name is Jared, by the way."

"Allie. I live here alone." Allie replied back as she snuck a quick look at the ceiling. Best not to tell him about her son without at least learning a little more about what kind of person he is. "Have a seat on the sofa, I'll just be a minute." Jared nodded and did as he was told while Allie walked off towards the kitchen.

A few minutes later she returned with a small plastic case about the size of a cigar box and sat it down on the table. "I'm no brain surgeon, but I know first aid and the basics." Allie said as she opened the case and took out some small bottles along with a roll of bandages and some sanitized wipes. "Let me see your shoulder."

"This gonna hurt?" Jared said with a slight giggle. "Only like hell." Allie replied back with a nervous smile. Without warning she then pressed a small cloth with disinfectant onto Jared's shoulder and held it in place. Best to get the painful part out of the way as soon as possible. Jared let out a muffled groan and squirmed a bit, but managed to keep his composure as Allie began to fix up his bite and wrap some clean bandages around it.

"Now is my chance to ask him a few questions." Allie thought to herself. "But what should I ask about...?"
12121.title: Nurse Allie

choices: Send out a group to look for other survivors
Send out a group to search for supplies
Work on barricading and securing the bowling alley
122.content:
Allie took a sip from her mug of wine as she looked out the second story window of Danny's Bowling Alley at the scene of carnage on the streets down below. Everything had happened so fast, a normal day turned into a nightmare as dead bodies began to rise and prey on the living. Each fresh corpse soon returned to a state of unlife as well, creating more and more undead until they started to overrun the entire town.

Allie turned away from the gruesome scene and decided to head back downstairs to see how the others were doing. All in all, there were just under a dozen people taking refuge at the bowling alley. Alley and her son, Tyson, a family of five who had introduced themselves as the Jordans, a young father and son known as Tim and Jamie, and a few loners named Cher and Aaron. Some had been here since the night before while the others came by earlier in the day.

Everyone had plenty of food thanks to the snack bar and the front doors were secured and barricaded enough to deter any threats, though some of the adults had begun to get nervous. Many of the people here had young children and knew that they couldn't stay trapped forever, especially with the backup generator at only half power already. The kids all seemed fairly content at least, playing free games and eating junk food without worrying about school seemed like a pretty good deal to them.

"Hey Allie, how are you holding up?" came a voice off to the side at one of the tables. It was Tim, who was eating a burger and fries alongside his son Jamie, who was enjoying a shake and pizza. Allie forced herself to smile as she took a nearby seat and polished off the last of her wine. "I'm not gonna lie, I've been better. I'm just glad everyone is okay." she replied as she looked over at Tyson, who was bowling against a kid from the Jordan family.

"Mostly, at least." Tim replied solemnly as he looked down at his wedding ring. "My wife and two of the older Jordan kids are still out there in that mess." He sighed as Allie put a hand on his shoulder. "I'm sure they're fine, they're probably just stuck holed up somewhere like us. I'm sure things will get sorted soon and then we can all go home." she replied, trying to keep his spirits up.

Tim smiled as Allie got up to go check on her son. "I sure hope so, thanks." With that Allie walked over to the other parents and watched as the kids continued their game. Allie was glad that things had stabilized a bit after the insanity of the past few hours, but she knew it couldn't last. If they were to survive they couldn't just wait around for someone to come along and save them. The police and the army could still be days or even weeks away from rescuing them.

Allie knew the others were thinking the same thing... the question is, what were they going to do?
122.title: Family Gathering

13.content: Good choice. Where will Mr. Hanson be starting?
13.title: Mr. Hanson

choices: He decides to do a quick patrol of the nearby area
131.content:
Hanson stirred the small fire in front of him gently as the chilly wind blew through the gaps and holes in his cobbled together shelter. He had made the shack himself from wood he had gathered a few years back, but he was no carpenter and constantly had to repair and maintain it, especially around this time of year when the temperatures dropped. Honestly, the fact that he hadn't frozen to death yet was a minor miracle.

He listened to the fire sizzle and pop along with the groans of the things that were walking about outside. Despite the isolation of his makeshift house several uninvited guests had shown up late last night and up until about an hour ago. They were slow and weak, nothing compared to a man like Hanson, but their numbers seemed to grow as the day wore on. At the rate they seemed to multiply it would only be another day or two before he got overrun.

Hanson gripped a small hatchet in his hand and pulled back the thick blanket he had set over the doorway of his small home. He saw two of the small ones off in the field about 50-70 yards away stumbling by just under the tree line in front of the local forest. They wouldn't see him, but Hanson didn't like letting in more cold air than he needed to.

With a sigh he turned over a log on his tiny campfire and went through his backpack. He still had some snack food, two flashlights, spare batteries, a multi-tool and his small collection of loaned library books, due back in just under two weeks. He knew if this kept up he'd have to leave soon, but hiking to town in the cold was dangerous, even if it was only a mile or two away. He took a moment to consider his options as he looked over his hatchet in the dim glow of the fire.
131.title: In The Cold

choices: Hanson checks on a house with the lights off

1312.content:
Hanson knew it would be difficult to reignite the fire if he didn't bring back any matches or a lighter, which made it hard for him to put it out as he buttoned up his jacket and put on his backpack. He decided to stash most of his supplies away in case of emergency and to make sure he had plenty of room in his backpack so he removed everything except for one of the flashlights, some spare batteries, his multi-tool and a bag of chips.

After taking one last minute to look around and make sure his meager possessions were secure he headed out into the cool chill of the afternoon air. It was snowing heavily, making it hard to see things in the distance aside from a few lights from distant houses. Hanson didn't want to stay out in the cold longer than he had to and was quick to begin his short hike into town. The snow was several inches deep, but his thick boots helped keep his feet from getting numb.

Truth be told, Hanson had seen his fair share of extreme conditions in his younger years and wasn't unnerved by the potential blizzard brewing around the town. What made him uneasy was the otherworldly chill in the air. Hanson had a strong gut feeling for when things were going to shit... and right now it told him things were going straight to FUBAR even with the walking corpses roaming about.

In just a few minutes the road leading into town came into view beyond the patch of bushes lining the ditch. On the other side of the road was a forest so thick with snow build-up it looked like someone had poured mashed potatoes all over the treetops. Hanson was cautious, even though he wanted to get to town as quick as possible. After all the shit he had seen the past few days he wouldn't be surprised to see a damn yeti pushing through the woods.

Amazingly enough, Hanson made it to the outer edge of town without incident and slowed his pace only slightly as several houses began passing him by on either side. Some still had their lights on, but most were dark and a few were even boarded up. For a moment Hanson considered checking on them to see if anyone might be willing to let him inside for a while and explain what the hell was going on. It would be nice to have some shelter, but in a situation like this there was no telling how people might react...

13123.content:
Hanson didn't like the idea of relying on others, but he knew when cooperation and teamwork was needed and today was definitely the beginning of one of those times. Once things got worse he knew it would be better to be part of group rather than try to go alone. After all, those undead monsters seemed to be multiplying by the hour and it wouldn't be long before they outnumbered the humans ten to one... if they didn't already.

Hanson walked up the snow covered driveway of a small house on the edge of the woods. This was one of the few places to still have a vehicle in the yard so it probably also had the best chance of still having someone inside. When he reached the door he knocked gently enough so that someone could hear him without sounding too aggressive like a burgler or home invader. When no answer came he turned to leave before hearing something stir inside.

Hanson stood his ground and readied himself to swing his hatchet if a threat lurked behind that door when it opened. The footsteps stopped right in front of the door and then everything fell silent for a few seconds. Just as Hanson was about to knock again a soft voice shaking with fear came from the other side.

"He-hello? Is anyone there?" It was barely audible through the door and Hanson tried to speak up when he answered. "Yes, ma'am. I'm from a ways down the road and could use some shelter. Most people call me Hanson, may I come in?" A longer silence followed as he leaned in close to make sure he didn't miss the reply. "It's awfully cold out here." he added as he took a quick look around the front yard to make sure it was still clear.

Finally, the door opened slightly as a small woman peeked through the gap. "Hanson? I know you... my husband has seen you hunting in the woods around here. You live in that shack up the road." she replied as she looked him over. Hanson tried his best to look nonthreatening as he lowered his scarf to show her his whole face. "Alright, you can come in for now. Be warned my husband is in the other room cleaning his guns, so don't cause any trouble." she says meekly as she opens the door.

"Thank you very much." Hanson replied as he walked into the small little house. The living room in front of him was like most you'd see in any home, a tv was broadcasting from the local news station and an inviting leather sofa was occupied by a couple of young boys reading comic books next to a young woman in an orange hunting cap. "Must be her kids." Hanson thought to himself as he wiped the snow off his feet and left his boots near the door.

"Come with me." The woman instructed. "You'll need to talk with my husband." Hanson nodded and followed her into a small room with various hunting supplies decorating the walls and table. Aside from a few gun racks and mounted deer heads the room was fairly basic with a single small window overlooking the front yard. "Honey, we have a visitor." the woman called as she gently knocked on the open door.

"Send them on it, I'm not busy." came the reply as the man turned to face them. "Happy to meet ya, stranger." he says cheerfully as he extends his hand. He was a fairly skinny man, but with a lot of bulk and a somewhat muscular frame. In addition to a flat top haircut he had short mustache and a cigar clenched between his teeth. Hanson smiled as he shook the man's hand and introduced himself.
13123.title: Shelter For Now

133.content:
Hanson batted aside a young faun with half of its neck torn out as it lunged towards him. "This way Randal, I think I see the path up ahead!" he called out to a man in a green outfit and brown jacket as he stomped the dead deer's brains in. "I'm coming, just keep an eye out!" came the reply as Randal smashed the butt of his hunting rifle against the skull of a stray raccoon with its guts torn out.

It had only been a day at the most, but the undead creatures infesting the nature preserved seemed to grow thicker by the hour. Hanson hadn't even intended to come here, but when he witnessed a stray dog getting run over by a car on his way home he decided he had to stop and help. To his surprise the creature immediately got up as if nothing was wrong and attacked him and the driver.

At first Hanson thought that it had become hysterical from the pain and lashed out in confusion, but after it tried to bite his hand he noticed a deep fang wound on its neck as well as its glowing red eyes. Reasoning that it couldn't be saved he put the dog out of its misery with a single stomp to the head. After that he joined the driver when he drove to the nearby nature preserve to report what had happened and show them the carcass in hopes of finding out what was going on.

Unfortunately, the preserve was in the middle of its own crisis as several wild animals had suddenly begun to attack anything that dared to enter their domain, leaving the nearby campgrounds in a state of panic as park rangers scrambled to control the disaster before it could spread.

Hanson and the driver ran into Randal at the main station as he was preparing to head out and check on his buddies who had gotten cut off from the radio shortly beforehand. It was there that the full weight of the situation hit them as a bear covered in bloody wounds attacked the driver when he stepped outside to take a piss before the trio left. Randal managed to put the bear down with a few shotgun slugs to the head, but the driver passed away from his wounds shortly afterwards...and reanimated minutes later while the two men were bringing him back inside.

Hanson and Randal managed to avoid getting hurt, but the driver departed the same way as the bear had, leaving the two men to head out alone. The event had shaken Randal, but he hid it well as they made contact with a group of campers hiding in their RVs about three miles from the nearby ranger station. It was late and starting to snow very heavily when they arrived so the two ended up spending the night there to rest and recuperate from the nightmarish events of the previous day.

The next morning arrived with a fresh layer of snow and a continued flurry of small while flakes drifting down from the heavens. Taking the park truck back to the station would be impossible in the current conditions so Hanson proposed leaving the campers most of the guns and supplies while they set out on foot. Randal agreed with the plan and the two men set out on their journey to the ranger station to contact help.

That was roughly three hours ago and now that noon approached with even more ice and frost the whole situation began to look more and more hopeless. It was too late to just turn back now though, as Randal had found a path onto the hiking trail that would lead them right to the ranger station and cliffside overlook.

"It's not far now, just be careful. We're going uphill and this snow is making it hard to walk." Randal says as he catches up to Hanson near the base of a large tree. "How is your handgun holding out?" Hanson popped the clip and took a look at it before putting it back in. "Nine bullets in the mag, two more full clips after this one. Yourself?" Randal checked his own gun and let out a sigh. "I've got four shots. Maybe I should have taken an extra box of bullets."

Hanson paused for a moment and put a hand over his forehead as he scanned the clearing up ahead. Through the thick flurry of snowflakes he could make out a small brown building with a tall thin tower next to it. "I think we found the station." Hanson mumbles as he looks around to make sure the coast is clear. "Thank god." Randal replies as he wipes a bead of sweat from his brow. "Let's hurry and get inside before this weather gets any worse."
133.title: Don't Feed The Animals

1332.content:
Hanson wasted no time in climbing to the top of the watchtower to scout out the surrounding area. "I'll take a look around up here while you head inside." he called as he opened a door leading to a tiny room. "Roger that, see if you can get anyone on the radio while I check the phones!" Randal called back as he disappeared inside the station below.

After shutting the door back Hanson took a quick look around him. Aside from a tiny table and chair there wasn't much to the place. About the only decorations were a torn rug on the floor and a small dream catcher mounted on the wall just above one of the cracked windows. What immediately caught Hanson's attention wasn't any of that though, but a small radio that was sitting atop the table next to a box of rifle bullets...smashed by a blunt object of some kind.

"Son of a bitch..." Hanson muttered as he picked up a fragment of the broken radio and tossed it on the floor. "Someone did this deliberately...they must not want anyone to know what happened here." He shook his head and grabbed the box of bullets. "At least Randal will some extra rounds for his gun."

Before leaving Hanson stepped outside the small watchtower and moved over to the side of the railing overlooking the cliff below him. It was hard to see more than 1000 feet with the bad weather and trees in the way, but one thing Randal had remembered to bring was a couple pairs of binoculars. Hanson grabbed his pair and took a quick look around at the surrounding area.

The hillside to the east was too steep to worry about, but some movement caught Hanson's eye near the forest below him. On the far edge of the lower trail a large horde of zombies was slowly making its way up towards the ranger station and would likely arrive within half an hour. "Oh shit." Hanson cursed as he looked around for a way to cut them off.

Just when he was about to give up hope he spied a worn wooden bridge connecting the trail over a long drop about 100 feet below him. If he could collapse that bridge before they reached him they would likely fall to their deaths trying to get across. "I just need to find some sort of fire or explosive." Hanson noted as he put the binoculars away and began climbing down the ladder.

Suddenly, a loud scream rang out as a shot fired inside the ranger station...Randal was in some serious trouble. "Fuck!" Hanson shouted as he jumped past the last few steps to the ground. "They probably have what I need to drop the bridge in storage, but Randal's in the main building! If I stop to help those monsters might make it across the bridge!" Without wasting another second Hanson broke into a sprint as Randal let out another scream and fired a second shot out of his rifle.

Matt hated the idea of going outside alone, but if he didn't get out of here soon he'd likely find himself snowed in with a mob of frozen corpses. Even if he didn't run out of supplies he doubted he'd be able to fend off a large group of zombies by himself, especially ones like the thing he had seen through his window. It had been hard to see from his motel room but the large flying undead had picked up another zombie and carried it off somewhere.

If monsters like that were out there hidden in the blizzard covering Glitterice what chance did he have to survive, even with some kind of support? Matt zipped up his coat as he walked over to the window and pulled back the curtain to get a good look at the outside. The snow was still falling, but most of the walking corpses were walking down the road towards something that caught their attention behind a building.

Matt figured now was the best chance he'd have with them distracted and grabbed a knife before walking out into the cold. "Fuck my life." he groaned as he looked over at a gap torn out of the railing where someone or something had fallen down into the parking lot. At least he now knew what that loud thump he heard the other night was. He peered down at the smashed roof of a car that had frozen streaks of blood trailing off into the snow. Great, whoever died was probably still out there wondering around.

With a new resolve to get done as quickly as possible Matt walked over to the neighboring door and opened the knob with his knife at the ready. The inside was shrouded in darkness, but that was quickly fixed by him flicking on the nearby lightswitch. Hopefully the power would hold out for at least another day or two. Without some sort of heating unit survivors would have to rely on making fires to stay warm... if there were even any other survivors left.

After a few minutes looking around it became clear that whoever had been here before left in a hurry when this shit first went down and that they took everything of value with them. There wasn't even a single bar of soap in the bathroom. With a sigh Matt headed back out into the freezing air to check on the next motel room. Empty as well except for a bottle of ketchup and some condiment packets from the local diner. Better than nothing.

After another empty room Matt came to a door covered in a thin layer of frost. An uneasy feeling swept over him as he tried to peek in through the motel window, but it was froze over as well. "I know its cold out, but unless some motherfucker set off a liquid nitrogen blast inside this place it shouldn't be froze over like this." he noted as he tried turning the knob on the door. It creaked and groaned as it turned in his hand.

Matt didn't like this, but there were only two other rooms left to search on this floor before he'd have to make his way downstairs and he had very little to show for his efforts so far. He needed to find some more supplies, but his gut told him something was dangerous about this room. After a moment of thinking he decided to...

He had been buying some supplies from the mall when he met a couple of collage chemistry students, Ryan and Luke. He learned that they were secretly making hard drugs, specifically meth. In need of an easy way to make some money, Matt offered to help them with selling their product. However, after setting up a deal, their buyer attempted to rip them off. In the ensuing fight, Ryan was killed. Though Matt managed to kill the buyer, Ryan quickly came back and attacked Luke, tearing out a large chunk of his neck. A few minutes later, he too came back and attempted to kill Matt, who was forced to put Luke down by bashing his head in with a rolling pin. Soon after that, the college itself began to get overrun with these undead freaks. He had managed to acquire a .357 magnum revolver from a dead campus security guard.

He was typically a loner, but in a situation like this you could never have too many friends... or temporary allies at the very least. With a swift kick he broke through the jammed emergency fire exit and made a mad dash around the side of the main building that was facing the nearby woods. One good thing about the heavy snowfall was that any tracks would give away any nearby threats, something Matt was very thankful to have.

As he swung around to make his way through the main parking lot he noticed a large mob of slow moving undead converging around an RV that was sandwitched between the two rows of parked cars and trucks. There were about twenty or thirty in all, well over a dozen at any rate... far too many to try and take with just a revolver and no backup. "Sorry about your luck, but maybe I'll swing back later." Matt noted as he crouched down and began moving towards the far end of the lot.

Up head was a thin treeline that separated the main campus from the offsite dorms next to the local gas station. Matt hadn't been here for long enough to know the full layout of the place but he had overhead Ryan talking about an extra dorm just up the road called the Northpoint Apartments as well. The day before Matt had stopped by to spend some of the money he had gotten from a few shady dealings to buy some new clothes and supplies before leaving town.

Unfortunately for him, heavy snowfall wasn't the only delay he'd experience during his time in this small town. The dead had risen just the day before and by 9:00 pm the whole building was on lockdown with most of its shoppers still inside. Many people had forced or snuck their way out, but several others remained to secure the doors and windows to prevent the horrors walking outside from getting easy access to them.

Alongside Matt, Leo and Janice were about twenty other people holed up on the second floor in a large Italian restaurant. They had plenty of food and water to last for weeks, though some people were getting restless after being forced to spend the night there. Matt was fairly indifferent to the whole situation, he had stayed at better places for sure, but also worse places. Such was life on the road.

"Up here, give me a boost." Leo said as he climbed onto a washing machine and grabbed ahold of a table leg for balance. With a small shove Matt and Janice got him high enough to see out the windows above the piled furniture and junk. It was about an hour past noon and the parking lot outside was a flurry of snowflakes above a thick blanket of white.

"Looks like we got about 3-5 inches." Leo said as he climbed back down. "Some of those undead fucks are still walking around too, I counted about a dozen hanging around the doors." Matt frowned at the prospect of being snowed in here for days while those things multiplied outside. He wasn't afraid for his safety, though he certainly didn't want to spend weeks here while he waited for help to arrive.

"What should we do? Do you think we can clear a path through them?" Janice asked as she turned to Matt. He simply shrugged and turned back to look over the barricade again...
145.title: Snowed In

choices: Secure a vehicle and drive to town to load up on supplies
Head out with a small group to sneak into town and loot some buildings
Head out alone and scout the area to see what they would be dealing with
1451.content:
"I don't want to stay here, but if we have to, we should at least prepare a little before shit gets bad." Matt said as he headed back towards the rest of the group. "We need to do a supply run now before the snow and zombies multiply." Leo quickly caught up to him and began walking alongside him with Janice following close behind. "Are you sure?" he asked. "We have plenty of food and water for a while and most of the stuff we need is here in the mall."

Matt frowned as he turned to Leo. "Yeah we got supplies for a couple weeks maybe, but someone already told me that this place doesn't have a gun store or any sort of medical shop besides a pharmaceutical place stocked with cold pills and painkillers. If those undead bitches find a way inside we're screwed, not to mention how many people we might find to help secure this place..." Matt took a deep breath as he turned to look straight ahead.

"All I'm saying is that we need to plan ahead. We got supplies here within reach, yeah, but what about the supplies we might not have access to tomorrow or the next day? We can always grab some shit from the store right next door to us, but if that fucking weather and undead plague keep up we might be stuck here for more than just a few days or weeks. I just think we need to grab the pie from the window before it closes and we lose it is all, you feel me?"

Leo was quiet for a moment, then silently nodded his head in agreement. "Good point, we may have a full scale blizzard on our hands soon, on top of the zombies..." The big man frowned as he thought over something. Janice didn't say a word, but the look on her face told Matt that she knew he was right. "We need to move soon, today might be our last clear day for a while and it'll be dark in just seven or eight more hours." Matt finished as the group began riding up the escalator to the second floor of the mall.

When they arrived back at the restaurant where the other survivors were Matt began to go over his plan to...
1451.title: What Lies Ahead...

14511.content:
Within an hour Matt and five other people were walking through a large parking garage on the far side of the mall towards their ride for the afternoon. There had been seven volunteers in all, but Meg and Sven were told by Matt to stay behind with the few extra guns and make sure the mall was defended. The other five, Luke, Neil, Lucy, Jerry and Roberta were to join Matt on his hunt for supplies.

Luke was the only one with any combat experience, having served as a member of the Army Rangers for years before being discharged with quite a few medals, including a Silver Star. Despite his skill as a soldier he was a friendly man in his late thirties with shoulder length brown hair and a blue bandanna wrapped around his forehead. His weapon was an M16 he had brought from home along with a few spare magazines of ammo. He also had his trusty Bowie knife.

Neil was a smart man, as well as the second youngest member of the team besides Matt. He works as a freelancer programmer and knows a few back doors in security systems that could come in handy. His weapon was a simple hunting rifle someone had brought from home along with an almost empty box of bullets. Just as well, as Neil wasn't a particularly good shot. He also carried a crowbar as his melee weapon.

Lucy was a local girl who grew up on a farm outside of town and loved nothing more than going on hunting and fishing trips with her daddy. Only nineteen years old, but a pretty good shot with her dad's crossbow. Her short light brown hair was tied into a small ponytail under her camo baseball cap and her sunglasses gave her a measure of style over the other members of the group. Her emergency weapon was a small claw hammer with her initials carved into the handle.

Jerry was a big man who was half Jamaican and half German and was on his way to a business meeting in Alaska when he got stranded here. He was fairly quiet, but at six and a half feet tall nobody bothered him about this or his taste in sweater vests. He carried a riot shotgun the group had managed to recover the night before as well as a golf club he had picked from a sports store in the mall.

Roberta was a somewhat overweight woman, which made it easy for her to surprise people with her speed. She had been given two handguns of slightly different models the group had managed to gather up just a few hours prior. Luckily, they both took the same caliber of bullet so it mattered little. Her back up weapon was a utility machete looted from a store in the mall, which was lightweight enough to give Roberta a serious edge over her slow moving foes.

Matt himself carried an uzi the group had looted from the back of a car the night before along with a single spare clip. That and a nice aluminum baseball bat. Matt wasn't a huge sports nut, but baseball was something he had greatly enjoyed playing in his youth with the neighbor kids when he could.

Lastly, each member of the group wore some SWAT armor that had been recovered from a van the previous night during the rioting in the parking lot. All except for Neil and Roberta, who wore Kevlar vests and sports pads on their elbows and knees along with bicycle helmets.

"There's our ride boys and girls." Matt said as he held up a pair of keys in his hand and pointed to...
14511.title: Gearing Up

choices: Call out to see if anyone is nearby
Drive past the station and head into town
145111.content:
"You guys climb in the back while me and Luke get up front." Matt said as he walked over and opened the back door to the cargo compartment. The others nodded as they climbed inside and Luke took his spot in the passenger seat up front. Matt tapped the side of the truck twice and called everyone inside over to a small hole about the size of a baseball that had been punctured into the side earlier. "Everybody got enough air and sunshine in there?" he asked as someone walked over to the side wall. A small feminine hand gave him a thumbs up to a few laughs from the inside and Matt headed towards the front.

"It may be a bumpy ride folks, try to stay quiet when we hit the road. We don't know what we'll find out here." With that Matt climbed into the driver seat and fired up the engines. Luke rested his right arm on the open window, his gun sitting at his side in the space between him and Matt. "Roll up that window when we get out on the road, is the safety on that thing on?" Matt asked as he gestured to the assault rifle pointed at the truck roof. Luke nodded and rolled up the window as the semi began cruising out of the parking garage past several other abandoned vehicles.

Up ahead an old man with unkempt hair as pale as the snow was stumbling around on a broken leg with about three inches of bone jutting out at the base of the knee. Wordlessly Matt brought up his uzi and and put a few rounds into the zombie's cheek and forehead through his rolled down window. "Nice shootin' there, even I would probably have trouble landing a shot like that from this distance." Luke said as he watched the dead old man disappear under the front hood of the semi as it passed. "Thanks." Matt mumbled in return as he made a turn onto the road leading up to the mall.

In a few minutes the crew were making their way down the main road leading to the town as various houses and barns passed by on either side of the road, all surround by barren trees and piling snow. "I'm gonna stop us up at the gas station on the edge of town. From there we can plan out how we're going to do this and refill the tank on this thing." Matt said as a cow missing half of its left side began moving towards the truck only to get tangled in a barbed wire fence as the semi passed over a short hill. "Damn, think I'm gonna swear off beef after today." Luke joked as he looked out his window at a collapsed house with corpses walking near it.

"I hear you..." Matt said disgustedly as he squinted through the falling snow at a building coming up on the right side of the road. "We're almost there. Get ready in case we have to do some clean up." A lone zombie in a floral print dress stalked the service area as if it were waiting for a car to pull in and refuel and pick it up any second. Aside from a bullet hole in her dress and left lung the young woman was in pretty good shape, perhaps it had not even been a few hours since her untimely demise. "You see that?" Matt said quietly as he slowed down to pull up in front of the gas station. Luke nodded and took the safety off his M16. "She's been shot."
145111.title: The First Mile

choices: Run to the others and try to leave before the bikers show up
Take up a position outside where he can keep his options open
1451111.content:
Matt placed his aluminum bat on the dashboard and quickly made sure his uzi was fully loaded. "Plan?" Luke asked as Matt opened his door and stepped out into the chilly winter air. "Stay here, but be ready. I'm gonna gas us up and scope the place out. If you hear gunshots come help me out, if you hear me scream then put the pull the fuck out of here and get your ass back on the road."

"You sure?" Luke replied as he moved his hand to to the door, ready to join Matt as soon as he requested it. "No need to risk all our lives on this shit right? Just keep an eye out and get down if you see someone coming, most folks might be content to leave us alone but there are some real assholes out there." Matt responded as he gently closed the door and passed in front of the truck on his way inside the gas station.

The zombie woman in the dress began stumbling towards him but it was a simple matter for Matt to knock her to the ground and smash her head in with a nearby rock. "Not clean or pretty, but it gets the job done. Good thing she was such a skinny little bitch." Matt noted as he dropped the rock and headed towards the front doors of the gas station.

The front windows were cracked, but with no visible blood and the door seemed to be undamaged. After a quick pass around the building Matt headed back over to the pumps and began to fuel the semi. Luke opened the door to stretch his legs a bit and walked over to where the tank was to monitor it. "Outside's clear?" he asked as Matt looked over at the main entrance. "Yeah, I'm gonna check the inside, see if we can grab some snacks and shit to bring back. Open the back door and let our crew get some fresh air while were stopped."

Luke nodded his head and flicked the safety back on his assault rifle. "Alright, I'll shut if off once we have enough. We leave in what, twenty minutes?" Matt flashed him a quick thumbs up on his way back to the front door and took a deep breath as he quietly slid it open. He couldn't quite figure it out, but something about this place didn't feel right.

"Ugh what is that smell?" he groaned as he headed over to the front counter. "Did one of those things die in here or something?" After a quick glance at the area behind the cash register he moved over to the aisles of snacks and other little travel essentials. It seemed like the smell grew stronger the closer he got to the back freezers. "I've got a fucked up feeling about this..." he whispered silently to himself as he kept is uzi pointed in front of him.

Unfortunately, even the nastiest zombie couldn't compare to the sight that awaited him, a sight he had seen firsthand before. The image of pure unfiltered human cruelty.

There, lined up against the back freezers were roughly a dozen human corpses. The oldest was a man in his sixties, the youngest, a five year old girl. Some had multiple bullet wounds on their limbs and torsos, others had stab wounds from some kind of bladed object like a knife or cleaver. All of them had a single bullet wound to the forehead and looked to have begun the process of decay about a day ago.

For the first few seconds Matt merely stared in shock as painful memories flooded back to him. Thoughts of his brother, his family, his friends, the life he had before...the cop that took everything away from him... For nearly a minute the only sounds were the buzzing of flies and Matt's own heavy breathing.

"My god." a voice rang out behind him, snapping him back to reality. Matt wordlessly turned to see Neil standing behind him, holding his hunting rifle with shaking hands as he looked over the scene of the massacre. "Who...why...?" he choked out as he took a few steps back. Matt only stared down at his own weapon as his clear head returned. "I don't know." he answered. "But we need to get the fuck out of here now. Grab whatever you fuckin' can from the shelves and meet us outside in a minute, we're leaving."

Neil muttered out some form of reply but it was immediately cut off by a sound in the distance...of approaching motorcycles. "No...fuck... fuck! Fuck! Fuck!!!" Matt cursed as Neil turned to the direction the noise was approaching from. There didn't seem to be many of them, but if they had guns that sure as hell wouldn't matter...what should Matt do?
1451111.title: Uninvited Guests

145113.content: Matt pointed to a large blue bus sitting nearby. They easily recognized it as a prison transport bus. Matt climbed on board the bus as the others followed and got seated. Taking the wheel, Matt started the bus, put it in gear, and drove out of the mall parking lot, making his way towards Glitterice. For most of the ride, everyone was quiet. After driving for several minutes, the group stumbled upon,
